title: Carbon dioxide and PM - effects on climate change

content.prompt: Carbon dioxide and particulates are emitted by volcanoes. Particulates form stratospheric aerosols that reflect sunlight. Which of the following best describes the impact of atmospheric carbon dioxide and stratospheric aerosols?

choices.label: Carbon dioxide contributes to global warming, and aerosols cause cooling.
Both carbon dioxide and aerosols contribute to global warming.
Carbon dioxide contributes to global warming, and aerosols have no effect on global climate.
Carbon dioxide reacts to form aerosols, leading to decreased global warming.
UV radiation causes carbon dioxide to break down, leading to increased stratospheric cooling.

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Explain environmental concepts and processes.
